title: Linux factor Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux factor command, its purpose, syntax, and practical examples to gain a deeper understanding of this useful miscellaneous utility.

meta.title: Linux factor Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux factor command, its purpose, syntax, and practical examples to gain a deeper understanding of this useful miscellaneous utility.
meta.keywords: Linux, factor, command, utility, practical examples, prime factorization

steps.title: Understand the Purpose of the factor Command

verify.name: Verify the purpose of the factor command
verify.hint: The output of 'factor 12' should be "12: 2 2 3", indicating that the prime factorization of 12 is 2 x 2 x 3.

steps.title: Explore the Syntax and Usage of the factor Command

verify.name: Verify the syntax and usage of the factor command

steps.title: Practical Examples of Using the factor Command

verify.name: Verify the prime factorization of a large number
verify.hint: The output of 'factor 1234567' should be "1234567: 3 7 59 2903", indicating that the prime factorization of 1,234,567 is 3 x 7 x 59 x 2,903.

verify.name: Verify the prime factorization of a prime number
verify.hint: The output of 'factor 17' should be "17: 17", indicating that 17 is a prime number.

verify.name: Verify the greatest common divisor of two numbers
verify.hint: The output of 'factor 24 36' should show the prime factorizations of 24 and 36, and indicate that their greatest common divisor is 6.
